VidÃ©o de Planet Djanet

The white crowned wheatear or "Moula Moula" in local tamahaq. The nomad's companion, a bird perfectly adapted to the desert life and is said to be a good omen by the Touaregs. The Moula Moula associated the presence of nomads/tourist groups to the presence of food (leftovers) and so became less fearful in these areas. It mainly eats insects and small lizards. 
If you visit the Tassili n'Ajjer you will no doubt observe it closely during lunch stops or even while walking during the day ğŸ¦ğŸ“·
.
.
.
#tassili #tassilinajjer #animalphotography #wheatear #desertlife #touareg #djanet #tadrartrouge #travel #nationalgeographic

Instagram post: Good morning from Oued Amais....

Good morning from Oued Amais.
Sleeping in a hammock in the Sahara desert ? Yes it's possible thanks to the vegetation present in Oueds (dry river beds that are flooded during rainy days) and especialy old accacia trees that provide a perfect thick shade !
.
We take lunch and spend an evening in this place during our one week tour in the Tadrart Rouge. Djanet
.
.
#djanet #sahara #tassili #tassilinajjer #amais #desert #travelphotography #hammock #accacia #savannah #backpacking

Cypress Valley

Cypress Valley of Tamaghit. Tassili n'ajjer plateau.

Only a few of these millennial endemic trees (~230) still live, exclusively on the Tassili n'Ajjer plateau. They are witnesses to a greener era of the Sahara as they can't multiply anymore due to the extremely dry weather.

#tassili #tassilinajjer #Sahara #naturewalk #desert #djanet #cypress #trees #naturebeauty #history #archeology
